str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
From dikaios; to render just or innocent.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural

str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
